title: Linking Progressivism and Humanistic Educational Philosophy to Indonesiaâ€™s Merdeka Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational philosophy theories and curriculum development experience
context.additional_context: Enhancing Educational Course Design Competencies for Current Science Field Practitioners

learning_goals: Analyze core principles of progressivism and humanistic educational philosophies and propose implementation strategies in scientific contexts

Learners can identify three philosophical elements (e.g., ethical dilemmas, ontological questions) from educational materials (e.g., novels, scenarios) using qualitative content analysis methods (thematic analysis, coding, etc.), write a one-page (approximately 500 characters) analysis report, and achieve over 80% on the report evaluation rubric (analytical depth, logical coherence, clarity of expression).
Understand and comparatively analyze the design principles of Indonesia's Merdeka Curriculum and propose improvement plans for science curricula

Learners can design one educational model reflecting learner agency (quarterly goal setting and self-assessment report writing) and environmental connectivity (including solutions for at least two community issues) over a six-month course, develop a project-based assessment tool (10-item checklist, 5-level rubric), and obtain approval from at least eight out of ten institutional evaluators.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
